course.title: Magical Realism and Its Discontent: Latin American Novels That Didn't Boom
course.meeting_text: M., 3-5, and an additional weekly section hour to be arranged
course.description: Carpentier and Garcia Marquez found a narrative form to express Latin America's aesthetic particularity through magic and marvel. Since the publication of Cien anos de soledad, its remarkable impact generated different experimental responses attempting to work through Latin American social reality in very different ways. We read novels and short stories by Carpentier, Garcia Marquez, Rulfo, Cortazar, Borges, Donoso, Saer, Cabrera Infante, Glantz, Bolano, Fuguet, Bellatin and Aira. Also comics and films.
